intro: Tacsonia canaliculata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with prominent veins and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
